title: Update Failed: Please Help
body: As I attempted to log into league this morning I was greeted with a message that my client was reloaded to a previous patch until I restarted the client to allow for an update, then it would restart and be a never ending loop not even allowing me to close the window to try to find a fix. I already tried reinstalling the game altogether, checked all security and firewall settings, even made sure my connection was ample to patch, and it is now saying that an unspecified error has occurred which probably means I dug myself further into a hole. If anyone knows a fix or is willing to help that would be much appreciated, thank you.

replies.body:
Thanks for the reports everyone!  There seems to be an issue with players failing to patch, and I've forwarded the details to interested parties for review.  In the meantime, take a few moments to go over each step of the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to troubleshoot.  This will help rule out possibilities with potential changes in security settings that might be preventing game files from being accessed.


I'll let you guys know if I get any updates or find any issues with our patching servers as well.  Hang tight!

> **UPDATE @ 10:53am PT** In some cases, [reconfiguring your DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5) may resolve the issue for some players.  Updates are also being offerred on the [service status](http://status.leagueoflegends.com/#na) page.  I know a few are moving their clocks back, but do this at your own risk.  Doing so may run the risk of unforseen issues with your OS as well as getting into a game.

Hi there Porocles, I tried these 2 options and they both worked for me, maybe it will help you guys identify the issue, Cheers for being so fast to reply.

1.Open your LoL installation folder, open CONFIG Folder, open ''LeagueClientSettings.yaml'' with notepad and you will see that under the line ''global'' there is a region line, modify that to a region other than yours, open the client, close it back, modify the file to your original region.
2.Or just open the client through the lol.launcher.admin.exe in your LoL installation folder, let it patch, change the region, close and reopen to change it back to your region.

Thanks for this info!  I'll pass it on for testing to see if it can act as a workaround in the meantime.  To clarify what these steps are doing, it's basically a janky way of forcing a repatch to help budge the patcher.  This can be good as the HRT is not currently processing a repatch.
i made my clock go back an hour, worked.
changing the date works as well
i changed the date back a day and it worked aswell
Worked for me as well.... lol
Several people have tried this and even though it can allow you back in, it kicks you out of the client again afterwards and the problem keeps happening.

If anyone has tried reinstalling the game, thinking it's an issue on their end like I did, neither of these options will work as there is no config folder and running the lol.launcher.admin.exe hasn't worked for me
I've reinstalled the game and same problem.

Thank you for your findings.
I tried the second one first, and get a basic message of 'Unspecified error occurred. Please check the logs for more information'...though you can't, as it's endless. No way to click on anything but the 'Retry' button. I'm trying your first method now.
Edit: First method didn't work either. T.T
Tried this.  changing region didn't do anything.  lol.launcher.admin.exe gets stuck calculating differences with 1 file scanned.
Can confirm works like a charm, thanks man!

FYI Reddit is reporting that if you set your system date back an hour and re-launch the client, it works.

I reset my time from Central to Mountain time and re-launched, got the initial 'Have to roll back' message, but the client DID Then successfully patch up.

Hope this works for everyone.

EDIT:  Confirmed that this works

Assuming you're on Win10:

1.  Close LoL client

2.  Click Start > Type in 'Change the date and time' > toggle the "Set time automatically" setting to "Off" > Click the "Change" button under 'Change date and time', and set it back 2 hours

3.  Launch LoL client, click through prompts, let it patch
Trying this...

Sorry bud, but all these changes we **HAVE ** to do on our end aren't the solution. Your client obviously broke somewhere along the line, so thanks for looking into it and keep us posted when the team has fixed it. I'm not going to put my stuff at risk. I'll wait.

EDIT : The NA service status page offers no updates as of now.
I uninstalled mine to see if it would help but now I can't even start the installation without getting a message that says "Unspecified error occurred. Please check the logs for more information."
Same issue as everyone here. Stuck in an endless loop of my client wanting to update but its unable to

Same problem for me and my friend who were both logged into the game. Seems like something on rito's end.

Edit: Used Hextech tool, ran as admin but did not change default ticks. It let me log in, and get into the client, and then a moment later the same thing happened. Currently running the 'Force repatch' option, will update.
Hey there, to get more info can you clarify what problem you're experiencing exactly?

Was logged in, got the 'game failed to patch reverting to previous patch' or whatever. League restarts, when it opens it tells me I'm on the previous patch and will repatch, then the first message repeats. Won't let me log in, no % on the patching thing. 

Hextech tool let me log in for a minute, then it happened again. I attempted to run the 'Force repatch' option but it keeps crashing with windows telling me the 'chromium embedded' thingy has stopped working.
I came out of a URF game and i got the message, I am going through the permissions guide, but I doubt this problem is on my side.

Checking your security is on the right track, because it sounds like something is blocking your game files from properly installing.  To be extra sure and that all possibilities are ruled out, I recommend starting off with our [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide.

Once completed, download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) and perform a clean reinstall to get this fixed up!  

I hope that helps! If the issue persists, though, get back to me with some more info like what % exactly you're getting the error.

there is no percent
as soon as i start it it gives the error
Thanks for the info!  Run through the permissions guide when you get a chance, and also make sure that your OS clock is properly sync'd as well.  Let me know how it goes!

I'm forcing a repatch with my hextech repair tool and it always stops halfway. Then a window pops up and tells me that the Chromium Embedded Framework has stopped working :/. Not sure what that means I'm no IT

Happening to me aswell. Just finished a game and got into an endless loop of going back to a previous patch and then trying to patch and failing. All of it's instantaneous and there's no permission issues.

turn ur clock back one hour on ur computer

There must be something wrong with the updating process or something, cuz there is no way that every person has the same problem with their systems or computers. Just my opinion

HOW TO FIX:

C: > RiotGames > League of Legends > lol.launcher.admin. (you MUST OPEN the launcher.admin version.) this will fix it 100% instantly!{{champion:126}}
This only worked temporarily for me.
It's working now, everyone! I was able to login!! Good job, riot! :)

Update - I left the patcher sitting on the error message when I posted earlier.
Just sat back down, and hit "Retry"
It's now working. Looks like something may have gotten borked on Riot's end.

Shadow Lan Gaming has figured out a possible solution to the log in issue. What worked for us is that we went in to the config files(riot games > LoL > config) and we removed the .yaml files in config folder.
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/LEAtaAWQ-fix-for-the-loop
